page.title: 04THE GARDEN CENTRE, COVENTRY.
page.content: After the war Mr Ducker (SENIOR) decided to move to the country setting up a gardening shop in{Binley {Woods}and growing plants in{Rugby.}In {1962}they combined the shop and field in{Brandon}and owned 7 acres of land. Mr. Ducker's son and his wife built it up from a bare field into a family business . Now, in 1985 they own 22 acres of land and rent 6 acres. A 2 acre pond supplies the fish they sell. Their employees work in the greenhouses, shop and fields. Mr. Ducker starts work at 7a.m. He prepares for the workers arriving at 8a.m. Mr. Ducker spends his day managing between the shop and nursery, meeting representatives and ordering things for the garden centre. He works wherever needed until 4.3Op.m.
